titleStmt.title: A New-years guift to the Templers on that eminent lawyer Sir Edmund Saunders his being chosen Lord Chief-Justice of England, when ploting knaves from justice fly away, then loyal templers shall come into play, when rogues, and traytors, dare not shew their face, then honest men again shall come in place, to the tune of, Joy to the bridegroom.

A New-years guift to the Templers on that eminent lawyer Sir Edmund Saunders his being chosen Lord Chief-Justice of England, when ploting knaves from justice fly away, then loyal templers shall come into play, when rogues, and traytors, dare not shew their face, then honest men again shall come in place, to the tune of, Joy to the bridegroom.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
This is a song wishing a newly-elected Lord Chief Justice success.
